item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Just you,' Hardy said when he got his breath back. 'All I want is you." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "The question, love, is whether you want me enough to take the risk." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Ah, Evie,” she heard him say softly, “I must have a heart, after all…because right now it aches like the devil.” “Only your heart?” she asked ingenuously, making him laugh. He lowered her to the bed, his eyes sparkling wickedly. “Also a few other things,” he conceded. “And as my wife, it’s your duty to ease all my aches." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "When Christopher finished, there was a moment of silence. Leo looked at Cam expectantly. “Well?” “Well what?” “Now is the time when you dredge up one of your blasted Romany sayings. Something about roosters laying eggs, or pigs dancing in the orchard. It’s what you always do. Let’s have it.” Cam gave him a sardonic glance. “I can’t think of one right now.” “By God, I’ve had to listen to hundreds of them. And Phelan doesn’t have to hear even one?" -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Cam held her closer. "Marry me, Amelia. You're what I want. You're my fate." One hand slid to the back of her head, gripping the braids and ribbons to keep her mouth upturned. "Say yes." He nibbled at her lips, licked at them, opened them. He kissed her until she writhed in his arms, her pulse racing. "Say it, Amelia, and save me from ever having to spend a night with another woman. I'll sleep indoors. I'll get a haircut. God help me, I think I'd even carry a pocket watch if it pleased you." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Asrai add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "A slow smile had curved St. Vincent's lips. 'Wives are a different case altogether. They require a great deal of effort but the rewards are substantial. I highly recommend wives. Especially one's own." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.description: "But sometimes normal just isn't happening. Sometimes crazy feels too good to resist." -- Lisa Kleypas
